intro: Cystopteris hirta, commonly known as the hairy spleenwort, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its hairy, glandular leaves that give it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rocks or tree trunks. Cystopteris hirta is widely distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
